intro: Galium kulluense, commonly known as Himalayan bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Asia, particularly in the Himalayas, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium kulluense is typically found in alpine meadows and forested areas at elevations ranging from 2,000 to 4,000 meters.
